sentence.Network_en: Some feminists sought reforms within the existing social order.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些女权主义者寻求在现存的社会制度内进行改革。

指生存 （Existence） 的需要、 相互关系 （Relatedness） 的需要和成长发展 （Growth） 的需要。 成就动机理论：通过对人的需求 …

entry.tran: （尤指与未来相对的）现存的，现行的，目前的
entry.def: Existing is used to describe something which is now present, available, or in operation, especially when you are contrasting it with something which is planned for the future.

example.ex: ...the need to improve existing products and develop new lines...
example.tran: 改进现有产品、开发新生产线的需要

example.ex: Existing timbers are replaced or renewed...
example.tran: 现有的木料进行了替换或翻新。

means.word_mean: 1. having existence or being or actuality;

sentences.sentence: "an attempt to refine the existent machinery to make it more efficient"
"much of the beluga caviar existing in the world is found in the Soviet Union and Iran"
"depletion of the oxygen existing in the bloodstream"

Sentence.sentence: Large companies have a difficult time switching into new markets because there is a temptation to put existing assets into the new businesses.
They find it costly to give up their existing assets
The danger is that although some rules need to be updated to protect consumers from harm, existing rental businesses will try to destroy competition
It runs counter to the existing literature on the subject.
They urge the government to revise its existing public policies
It may change the existing social structure.

sentences.en: an advance on the existing techniques
sentences.cn: 在现有技术基础上的进步

sentences.en: a critical reappraisal of existing ideas and social institutions
sentences.cn: 对当今思潮和社会制度的批判性重新评价

sentences.en: Any new building must be fitted into the existing appearance of the city.
sentences.cn: 任何建筑物都必须与本城目前的景观相协调。

sentences.en: But will he be able to work in with our existing team?
sentences.cn: 可他能够跟我们现有的球队协作吗?

sentences.en: Consensus politics places a high value on existing political institutions.
sentences.cn: 代表多数人意见的政纲强调现存政治机构的重要性。
